thread.title: Report: Fred Jackson crashes car while drag racing Marshawn Lynch
thread.title_full: Report: Fred Jackson crashes car while drag racing Marshawn Lynch | syracuse.com

author: Hank Domin | hdomin@syracuse.com
title: Report: Fred Jackson crashes car while drag racing Marshawn Lynch
text:
Here's the scene of accident outside VMAC pic.twitter.com/S70o2R34tt
— Bob Condotta (@bcondotta) October 21, 2015 Update: Fred Jackson says he was not drag racing Marshawn Lynch
Fred Jackson crashed his car while drag racing Marshawn Lynch near the Seattle Seahawks practice facility on Tuesday, according to a report.
According to TMZ , Jackson and Lynch — both former running backs for the Buffalo Bills — were racing down a public street as they left practice.
Jackson's black Corvette appears to have crashed into or near a stop sign. Lynch was reportedly driving a red Dodge Charger.
According to TMZ:
Several other players, including Richard Sherman, stopped at the accident scene and attempted to help Jackson out of the car. Police showed up, but we're told Seahawks staffers showed up and took Jackson back to the team facility — and Lynch drove off, uninjured. It's unclear if Jackson suffered any injuries.
The Seattle Times reports that Jackson was not injured in the crash.
Jackson, who spent the first nine years of his career with the Bills, was released by the team in late August. He was signed by the Seahawks just a few days later. Jackson has 10 carries for 52 yards and 12 catches for 110 yards and a touchdown this season.
Lynch has said that he considered Jackson a mentor when they played together in Buffalo from 2007-10.
Car being towed. pic.twitter.com/vCTRxzCB48
— Bob Condotta (@bcondotta) October 21, 2015 Skid marks on other side of street. pic.twitter.com/twfApCla95
— Bob Condotta (@bcondotta) October 21, 2015 Car now gone. pic.twitter.com/1b9xJZUFnf
